clinical_study.brief_title: Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Motor Function in Stroke Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Dual Site-dual Channel Non-invasive Brain Stimulation for Recovery of Motor Function in Stroke Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate the effect of dual site-dual channel non-invasive brain stimulation for recovery of motor function in post stroke patients. Simultaneous dual site-dual channel stimulation was applied by using two sets of transcranial direct current stimulation devices. All subjects will go through four conditions of transcranial direct current stimulation with for 30 minutes. Four conditions are 1) Dual stimulation: i) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex, ii) anodal stimulation on ipsilesional premotor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area. 2) M1 stimulation: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional primary motor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional primary motor cortex; 3) PMC stimulation: anodal stimulation on ipsilesional premotor cortex and cathodal stimulation on contralesional supraorbital area. 4) sham stimulation

primary_outcome.description: measure the motor threshold and amplitude of motor evoked potential in first dorsal interosseous muscle.

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in nine hole peg test
secondary_outcome.description: Nine-Hole Peg Test is used to measure finger dexterity in patients with various neurological diagnoses.

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in grip and tip pinch strength test
secondary_outcome.description: measure the hand strength (grip and tip pinch)

secondary_outcome.measure: changes in box and block test
secondary_outcome.description: box and block test measures unilateral gross manual dexterity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- acute stroke patients with less than 1 months after stroke onset
- unilateral hemiplegic stroke patient
- Fugl Meyer Assessment score between 9 to 84
Exclusion Criteria:
- less than 9 points in mini-mental status exam score
- history of psychiatric disease
